rows.title: Get the data received in a Flask request

379: <p>To get the raw post body regardless of the content type, use <code>request.get_data()</code>. If you use <code>request.data</code>, it calls <code>request.get_data(parse_form_data=True)</code>, which will populate the <code>request.form</code> <code>MultiDict</code> and leave <code>data</code> empty.</p>

<p>If the content type is recognized as form data, <code>request.data</code> will parse that into <code>request.form</code> and return an empty string.</p>

<p>To get the raw data regardless of content type, call <a href="https://flask.palletsprojects.com/api/#flask.Request.get_data" rel="noreferrer"><code>request.get_data()</code></a>. <code>request.data</code> calls <code>get_data(parse_form_data=True)</code>, while the default is <code>False</code> if you call it directly.</p>
